title: AI Tools & Integration Specialist
description:
**Join Schibsted marketplaces to help change the way people consume**
 Schibsted Marketplaces is transforming the way people consume goods and services with some of the strongest brands in the Nordics. With a proud history of innovation, we are committed to making everyday life easier, more efficient, and sustainable for millions of users.
   

  

**Shape the Future with Our Growing AI Unit**
 Our newly established AI Unit plays a vital role in enabling Schibsted to deliver on its vision. By accelerating teams across the organization to adopt and scale AI, we focus on integrating and developing cutting-edge technological capabilities while fostering organizational readiness to unlock AI’s full potential.
   

  

**General Description Of The Role**
 The AI Tools and Integration Specialist plays a critical role in identifying, deploying, and integrating AI solutions into the company’s business processes. This role is also responsible for contributing to the development of internal training programs, ensuring that employees, including non-programmers, can effectively use and build tools with AI technologies. You will work closely with product owners, technical teams, and non-technical staff to optimize workflows and democratize the use of AI across the organization.
   

  

**Main Responsibilities**
* Evaluate and Select AI Tools: Continuously assess AI tools available in the market, identifying those that align with business needs and will improve process automation and efficiency.
* Integration: Be technically responsible in collaborations to implement the integration of AI tools with existing IT systems, ensuring compatibility, security, and seamless operation.
* Contribute to Internal Training Development: Contribute to design and development of internal training materials on AI tools, empowering employees to use them effectively.
* Empower Non-programmers: Develop and support training initiatives aimed at enabling non-technical staff to become "tool builders" by leveraging AI tools, fostering collaboration across departments.
* Collaborate with Cross-functional Teams: Work closely with product development teams, IT, and business units to understand workflow challenges and propose AI solutions tailored to their needs.
* Documentation and Training: Develop and maintain comprehensive documentation for AI tools and processes, and assist in training team members to effectively use and manage AI systems.
* Bonus: use AI to automate as much of our own internal processes as possible to set an example for other units across the company.


**Experience**
**Qualifications & Experiences**
* 2-3 years of experience in software integration or testing, AI tools implementation, or IT systems development.
* Experience of using AI tools and integrating them in work flows.
* Experience in developing or contributing to (internal) training programs, especially for non-technical users.


**Skills**
* Strong understanding of AI technologies and their application in business contexts.
* Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to identify and resolve integration challenges.
* Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain complex AI tools and integration processes to non-technical stakeholders, including enabling non-programmers to become tool builders.
* Proficiency in programming and experience with api access to AI services (e.g.,OpenAI, Claude, Google Vertex etc).


**Personal Attributes**
* Builder: you lean into and leverage AI in your own work to speed up and/or automate deliverables and outputs
* Innovative Mindset: Curious and forward-thinking, with a passion for exploring how AI can transform business processes and create new opportunities.
* Collaborative: Ability to work effectively within teams, fostering a cooperative environment and building strong relationships across the organization.
* Analytical Thinker: Able to quickly understand complex workflows and propose AI-driven solutions to optimize them.
* Educator: Passionate about training and enabling others, particularly non-technical employees, to engage with AI tools and become creators of AI-driven solutions.


**Sounds exciting? Let us hear from you!**
 If you are looking for a workplace and a role where you could share your knowledge and expertise, learn and grow, get inspired, be yourself, and make a difference, let us hear from you by 12th January 2025
   

  

 Please note that due to Christmas holidays we will start the process applications in early Jan 2025

title: Enhetschef Strategi och Styrning
description:
Brinner du för strategisk IT-styrning och vill du vara med och forma framtiden för Region Stockholm? Upptäck hur din expertis kan bidra till att skapa en tillgänglig, öppen och trygg huvudstadsregion med framtidstro. Som Enhetschef får du möjlighet att bidra med din erfarenhet och kompetens tillsammans med dina medarbetare. Är du intresserad av en viktig roll och ta ansvar i en betydelsefull samhällskontext? Då ska du söka rollen som Enhetschef till regionledningskontoret.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Just nu pågår flera stora satsningar för att modernisera och framtidssäkra it-miljön i flera av våra kärnverksamheter hälsosjukvård, kollektivtrafik, regional utveckling och kultur. Digitalisering är en förutsättning för att klara av regionens framtida utmaningar där analytics, AI och machine learning är exempel på viktiga tekniska möjliggörare.
   

  

 Vi söker nu en enhetschef till avdelningen Strategisk IT på regionledningskontoret som tillsammans med IT-direktören ska säkerställa att Region Stockholm får ut mesta möjliga potential av digitalisering med stöd av it.
   

  

 Avdelningens uppdrag är att styra, utveckla, följa upp och samordna it, digitalisering och informationssäkerhet på strategisk nivå för hela Region Stockholm. Ett arbete som bedrivs i nära dialog och samarbete med förvaltningar och bolag.
   

  

 Som chef för enheten Strategi och styrning blir du en del av avdelningens ledningsgrupp och i ansvaret ingår att föra dialoger om och bereda it-strategiska vägval som stödjer Regions Stockholms förflyttning mot framtagna mål inom området. Du har personal och budgetansvar för en grupp av 10 anställda och ett antal konsulter.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 För att lyckas och trivas i rollen ser vi att du har förmåga att navigera fram till bra resultat i kombination med att skapa förtroende i de team du arbetar tillsammans med.
   

  

 Du beskriver dig själv som en trygg ledare och är beredd att fatta modiga beslut utifrån verksamhetens bästa, i en komplex miljö med många intressenter och prioriteringar. Vidare har du ett genuint intresse för att både lära dig och förstå den snabba teknikutvecklingen samt en universitets eller högskoleutbildning inom relevant område.
   

  

**Du har med dig erfarenhet av:**
* it-styrning och it-strategiskt arbete på koncernnivå
* planering och uppföljning av it-strategiska förflyttningar inom komplexa organisationer
* att arbeta med strategiska frågeställningar och kan se hur dessa påverkar de operativa besluten
* att framgångsrikt arbeta med ledare och samverka med ledningsgrupper på olika nivåer
* flertalet år som chef med personalansvar och en gedigen erfarenhet av att coacha dina seniora medarbetare


**Det är meriterande om du har:**
* erfarenhet av arbete i offentlig verksamhet


 Som person är du leveransorienterad och van att leda team på ett effektivt sätt där kortsiktig leverans och långsiktiga mål balanseras. Vidare har du en god förmåga att analysera och strukturera komplexa frågor och uppgifter samt kommunicera väl i både tal och skrift på svenska.
   

  

**Vårt erbjudande**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid.
   

  

 Vi har kollektivavtal och med det följer kollektivavtalade försäkringar, tjänstepension och möjlighet till löneväxling. För att du ska kunna ta ansvar för din hälsa erbjuder vi friskvårdsbidrag samt subventionerad sjukvård i form av kostnadsfri öppensjukvård. Du erbjuds även kompetensutveckling i olika former som exempelvis nätverk, mentor- och adeptsprogram samt ledarutbildning.
   

  

 Vi sitter i ljusa fina lokaler på Lindhagensgatan 98. Hit tar du dig enkelt med kollektivtrafiken.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Låter det här som något för dig ser vi gärna att du söker så snart som möjligt. Sista ansökningsdag är den 6 mars. För en komplett ansökan räcker det med att bifoga ditt CV. När du ansöker kommer du att få besvara ett antal frågor, dessa ersätter personligt brev.
   

  

 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Region Stockholm med IDG Recruitment. Vid intresse eller frågor kontakta Linda Wallin, Rekryteringskonsult på 072 2276720, linda.wallin@foundryco.com.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

**Övrigt**
 Tester kan komma att ingå i rekryteringsprocessen. Vi använder oss av Assessios tester MAP och Matrigma. MAP är en personlighetstest och Matrigma är ett problemlösningstest som båda bygger på arbetspsykologisk forskning. Testerna används som ett komplement till dina erfarenheter och kompetenser.
   

  

 Regionledningskontoret stödjer regionstyrelsen i uppgiften att leda, styra, samordna och följa upp Region Stockholms verksamheter. Förvaltningen arbetar strategiskt och operativt utifrån ett koncernperspektiv och ger regionstyrelsen de underlag och det stöd den behöver i sitt uppdrag att utveckla Region Stockholm. Regionledningskontoret ansvarar även för stöd till klimat- och regionutvecklingsnämnden samt för verksamhetsstödjande tjänster inom koncernen. Läs mer här
   

  

 Att söka jobb i Region Stockholm Vi eftersträvar jämställdhet och jämlikhet på vår arbetsplats och ser gärna sökande med olika bakgrund och förutsättningar. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via detta system. Ansök genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök”. Ansökningar per brev eller e-post beaktas inte. Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser. Vårt rekryteringssystem kan inte hantera anonyma ansökningar eller sökande med skyddade personuppgifter. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ber vi dig att kontakta den kontaktpersonen som finns angiven i annonsen. Din ansökan kommer då att hanteras utanför rekryteringssystemet. Du bör även vara försiktig med vilken information du lämnar i din ansökan och endast ta med information som är relevant för den aktuella befattningen. Region Stockholm ansvarar för hälso- och sjukvård, kollektivtrafik, regional utveckling och bidrar till kulturlivet. Varje dag, dygnet runt. I landets snabbaste växande region. Tillsammans skapar vi Europas attraktivaste storstadsregion. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss i Region Stockholm
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/1143 | Facklig företrädare: Tommy Mäntynen, Vision tommy.mantynen@regionstockholm.se, Jonas Ivarsson, SACO 08-12314458, Thérèse Juvall, Akademikerförbundet SSR 08-12313942, | Publicerat: 2025-02-13 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-03-06

title: SAP S/4 HANA PM/EAM Technical consultant
description:
Hi all,
   

  

 We are in search of SAP S/4 HANA PM/EAM Technical Expert to our reputed client in Sweden.
   

  

 This is a technical role. Technical implementation, working with test, error root cause analysis for S/4 HANA journey/implementation.
   

  

* Collaborating closely with cross-functional teams, including technical consultants, ABAP developers, and other functional consultants
* Configuring SAP PM modules to meet specific business requirements and implementing custom solutions.
* Write blueprints
* Facilitating communication between technical and non-technical stakeholders to address issues and ensure smooth integration
* Conducting thorough testing and validation to ensure the seamless transition of functionalities from the old system to the new one.
* Adapting to changing project requirements and collaborating with various functional consultants and key users from MM, FI, and authorization modules
* Understand custom developments


 Skills:
   

  

* Strong understanding of SAP PM processes with at least 5 years of experience in implementation or support roles
* Process understanding of standard processes in SAP PM & S/4 HANA
* Being able to communicate between business and other functional consultants
* Proficient in writing blueprints, understanding requirements
* Fluent in English (speaking, reading, and writing) to effectively communicate with stakeholders in multinational environments


 Strong knowledge of integrating SAP PM with other SAP modules like , MM (Materials Management), and EHS (Environment, Health, and Safety)
   

  

 Optional: Basic knowledge of ABAP programming for troubleshooting and understanding custom code related to SAP PM. (As there are big custom developments)
   

  

 Fluent in English.

title: Global Head of Learning and Development (Director Level)
company_industry: Environmental Services, Civil Engineering, and Oil and Gas
description:
**Global Head of Learning and Development**
**Overview**
 Global Learning is committed to developing our people to help meet today’s sustainability imperatives around the globe. The
 **Global Head of Learning and Development** 
 leads both the operational and transformational aspects of learning across our organization, supporting strategic initiatives that drive positive change in our world.
   

  

**ERM** 
 embraces a comprehensive approach to learning that reflects real-world skill development: 70% hands-on experience, 20% mentoring and coaching, and 10% formal training. This methodology, combined with our growth mindset culture, enables our people to continuously evolve their capabilities.
   

  

 Your creative vision will shape how we engage learners throughout their ERM journey. Whether you are designing innovative leadership programs, creating immersive technical training, or developing new approaches to knowledge sharing, you will be able to reimagine effective learning for all ERMers alike staying aligned with business conditions. This is your purview and charge. Creativity is welcome in this role!
   

  

 You will collaborate with passionate partners, key stakeholders, and senior leaders who share your commitment to developing our people. Together, you will help ERM build the skills needed to tackle complex challenges across the business.
   

  

**Team**
 Our Global Learning and Development team consists of talented professionals from around the world through an innovative organizational structure. While unified under central leadership, our team members are strategically positioned across different regional and global business units.
   

  

 Although all learning roles report up to this global lead role, some individuals are part of a regional or global business unit P&L yet receive their direction of work from Global Learning and Development leadership. This thoughtful structure enables us to drive consistent global learning initiatives while staying flexible enough to adapt to local cultures, regional needs, and diverse skill requirements.
   

  

 Within the larger Global People Team, our vibrant team includes Learning Business Partners, Learning Administrators, Learning Curators, and Coaches located throughout various remote locations. What makes our global team special is the remarkable ability to connect with and support a diverse, worldwide community of learning professionals. This collaborative spirit helps us create meaningful impact across cultures and continents.
   

  

**Deliverables**
* Onboarding – Work across the globe to help welcome new ERM new talent at every level in every role and bring new talent into the organization.
* Career progression – Lead the learning team to create and sustain innovative and continuously improving and exciting career stage learning so that individuals are ready to take on new roles as team leaders, as managers and leaders, as client relationship managers and in the many other exciting roles that people take on in their careers at ERM.
* Programs – Innovate with the learning team new ways to make learning of all kinds – from compliance to skills-based learning engaging and exciting, while ensuring that all ERMers are well prepared to be physically, mentally, legally and technologically equipped, engaged, and prepared for their roles in our modern world.
* Leadership – Role modelling is an important part of helping ERMs unique culture come to life. Working with the Learning teams around the work to develop our leaders through leadership preparation, facilitated sessions, small group interaction, external sessions and innovative curricula of all kinds and for all levels of leadership.
* Coaching – Own any internal and external coaching programs, ensuring they are engaging opportunities for people to work one on one with others and are improving in the determined areas for successful succession.
* Business Partnering Relationships – Work with internal and external partners in the delivery of ERMs learning agendas. Whether it is technology, Partner learning moments, vendor management or dozens of other partnerships, building relationships and managing partnerships is at the core of this role. This role interacts with key senior leaders for direction and feedback, as well as an Executive Sponsor and Steering Committee for guidance and support.
* Commercial – Work with global commercial leaders to continually diagnose, co-design and co-deliver learning solutions aligned to ever evolving business requirements.
* Learning Evaluation – Continually measure success and relevance of all learning deliverables and make appropriate changes, enhancements and corrections as needed.


**Background / Experience**
* 10+ years in Learning function, with track record of building and implementing learning strategies
* Successful business partnering skills
* Creative and innovative in providing learning solutions for the business
* Experience in successfully managing and controlling a budget of more than $2M, as well as seeking cost cutting improvements without sacrificing quality and service
* Experience Coaching Senior Leaders
* Experience building learning programs and evaluating impact
* Successfully experienced team leader of a virtual team
* Experience with learning technology – ideally knowledge of LMS platforms e.g. Cornerstone, Workday Learning
* Understanding of ERM commercial expectations, KPIs and Contribution Statements for all levels
* Ideally experience of working in professional services organisations


**Attributes**
* Comfortable with ambiguity
* Able to influence, inspire and motivate others
* Able to define and implement a compelling vison and strategy
* Growth mindset, with commercial lens to people development
* Collaborator and team-player, able to flex behaviours and approach
* Strong appetite for innovation, and comfort with digitally enabled change


**Accountable for:**
* ERM’s Learning Management System, (The Academy), providing access to learning programs to all ERMers globally
* Management of global L&D budget, ensuring delivery of cost-effective solutions, whether internally designed and delivered or through partnership with external vendors
* Management and development of global L&D team, bringing together regionally based colleagues to work towards aligned and consistent goals, building capability, appropriate organisation and processes, and ensuring engagement and retention
* Learning technology – working with Business Excellence team and IT to ensure optimal learning processes and systems in place
* Metrics, reporting and evaluation of learning, together with regular reporting on Learning and leadership MI which will help inform strategic decision making
* Definition and delivery of Learning and Leadership strategy that will enable ERM’s growth agenda, and encompass all aspects of capability build – e.g. technical, leadership, commercial, professional development, compliance etc
* Alignment with broader People Agenda, partnership with CoEs and Regional HRD activity
* Bringing best practice and insights into ERM’s learning and leadership approach, ensuring ERM is providing agile, impactful, engaging, commercially oriented development solutions
* Ensuring Business Partnering arrangement in place to work to diagnose, co-design and co-deliver learning solutions aligned to business requirements


***Who We Are:***
 As the largest global pure play sustainability consultancy, we partner with the world’s leading organizations, creating innovative solutions to sustainability challenges and unlocking commercial opportunities that meet the needs of today while preserving opportunity for future generations.
   

  

 At ERM we know that creating a diverse, equitable and inclusive work environment is an essential part of making our company a great place to build a career. We also see our diversity as a strength that helps us create better solutions for our clients. Our diverse team of world-class experts supports clients across the breadth of their organizations to operationalize sustainability, underpinned by our deep technical expertise in addressing their environmental, health, safety, risk and social issues. We call this capability our “boots to boardroom” approach for its comprehensive service model that allows ERM to develop strategic and technical solutions that advance objectives on the ground or at the executive level.
   

  

 Please submit your resume and brief cover letter.
   

  

 ERM does not accept recruiting agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, ERM employees or any other company location. ERM is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
   

  

 ERM is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.
   

  

 Thank you for your interest in ERM!

title: Event Project Manager (temporary position for 1,5 years)
description:
**This is a temporary position for 1.5 years to cover a maternity leave** 




 Are you our new 
 
 Event Project Manager
 
 , ready to make a significant impact on Dustin’s strategic position in the industry? We’re looking for a social individual to join our international team of Event Project Managers who will plan, execute and follow-up on Dustin's marketing events within our B2B segments in some of our Nordic countries. 
   





****This is what makes the position as Event Project Manager unique:****
**Innovation** 
 : Lead innovative marketing events across the dynamic B2B segments in the Nordic region.
 



**Collaboration** 
 : Collaborate with diverse, high-performing teams to drive meaningful business results.
 



**Creativity** 
 : Utilize your creativity and organisational skills to enhance brand visibility and customer relations.
 



*My name is Stina Samolov. I am the Group Manager Events - Nordics & BLX. As a leader, I believe in empowering my team with trust and confidence, expecting everyone to deliver according to plan. I embrace the principle of freedom with responsibility and strive to foster a positive atmosphere, knowing it drives the best results for both the company and our employees.* 




**Your role & influence as 
 **Event Project Manager****




**Responsibility:** 
 You will be given responsibility for planning, leading, executing, and following up on marketing events within Dustin's B2B segments in the Nordic countries, ensuring seamless integration of vendor collaboration and joint marketing efforts to generate leads and foster growth while adhering to set time frames, goals, and budgets.
 



**Collaboration** 
 : You are the strategic and operative Project Leader and take care of Dustin's events from A-Z, collaborating closely not only with your immediate team members and the Marketing & Brand department but also with other departments such as Sales, Communication, and Sustainability, ensuring that our event strategies align with our organisational goals.
 



**Core activities:** 



* Accordingly to the Event Marketing & Activity Plan you plan, coordinate, execute, and follow up on marketing events projects.
* Monitor time frames and budgets, ensuring delivery of event brief objectives.
* Prepare and hold presentations related to the events for the project group and stakeholders.
* Research, secure and negotiate agreements with venues and other suppliers.
* Keep up to date with trends to always be one step ahead in the local market.



****This is what we imagine you bring****




 We envision you as a curious and driven individual who is creative and enjoy structured planning, and effective communication while driving impactful marketing events in collaboration with diverse stakeholders.
 



**Additionally,** 
 it's important that:
 


* Minimum 3-5 years of experience with event planning & management, negotiation, marketing, and communication.
* Technical skills in utilizing event planning tools and project management software.
* Fluent in English and one of our Nordic languages.







**It would also be nice if you have some of the following:** 



* Previous experience working at, or closely with an Event Agency.
* Social skills and a strong network within the local market.



****What can you expect next?****




 We will treat your application anonymously. We expect the following steps in the recruitment process:
   




* Telephone screening with TA Partner Manon van Lieshout
* Assessio personality assessment
* 1st interview with TA Partner Manon van Lieshout
* 2nd interview with current Event Project Manager Rebecka and Group Event Manager Stina
* References



 For questions about the position, please contact the TA Partner Manon van Lieshout via e-mail: manon.vanlieshout@dustin.com 
 



**Please apply with an English resume**

title: Brand Marketing Lead - The Hunter, Call of the Wild Franchise
description:
**Why are we hiring for this role?**
 Avalanche Studios Group is hiring a Brand Marketing Lead to manage brand and marketing strategy for the worlds number one hunting game; The Hunter: Call of the Wild. The position involves leading a team of marketers and implementing innovative brand and marketing strategies that create impact and stimulate demand.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Act as chief marketing liaison to the game leadership team; ensure they're equipped for achieving commercial success.
* Advocate for a deep understanding of player needs in all marketing and product decisions.
* Develop and oversee the implementation of an annual live marketing strategy and manage marketing budget forecasting.
* Ensure we have a clear framework for measuring the value of activities and know what drives sales and brand growth.
* Establish marketing growth strategies, setting multi-year brand goals.
* Track and report on our marketing performance using a robust KPI framework.
* Use player insights to assist development teams in designing games that align with player needs.
* Support the creation of unique product positioning and selling points in collaboration with the game leadership team.
* Work with the Insights team to deliver player and market data that informs product and marketing decisions.
* Build the brand framework and platform for the franchise, maintaining consistent brand attributes, tone, and style.
* Coordinate with game and marketing leads to align our marketing strategies with company objectives.
* Contribute to the strategic direction for the Call of the Wild franchise.
* Lead, mentor, and manage a marketing team to foster creativity, strategic thought, and excellence.
* Keep connected to games industry developments and monitor player & market trends to bring the latest thinking to our marketing work.


**Who Are We Looking For**
 We're seeking a visionary leader with vast commercial knowledge and robust data understanding. You're an experienced strategist keen on measuring marketing performance and guiding a team to achieve business objectives. You should have a passion for games, and the ability to both mentor others and anticipate market trends.
   

  

**Role Context**
 As part of the Marketing Leadership team at Avalanche Studios Group, the Brand Marketing Lead will report to the Head of Marketing. You'll be pivotal in our mission to engage our players through the delivery of immersive gaming products framed by compelling brand narratives.
   

  

**Additional Information**
 This role is based in Stockholm, Sweden, in a hybrid office/home environment. Expect some international travel, and it is vital you have excellent English communication skills. We prefer candidates with experience at an international games publisher, but we may consider similar tech or entertainment industries.
   

  

*Note: Research shows under-represented groups in the industry (especially women) might not apply to a job if they don’t check off every requirement. At Avalanche, we’re more about your drive to learn and interest in tackling challenges than what’s on your resume! So don’t stress if you don’t tick every box— shoot us your application anyway! Diverse opinions and different experiences are what make our teams so great, not itemized lists of qualifications.*
**The Stockholm location**
 Our Stockholm office is situated in Södermalm, the beating heart of the city’s game industry. It’s a physical representation of our games – the lush vegetation of Just Cause and theHunter: Call of the Wild meets corroded metal straight out of Mad Max. It has everything you need to make it your creative base camp.
   

  

**Our values**
 At Avalanche Studios Group, we create worlds beyond limits. But that’s not exclusive to our games, so we’re committed to developing a diverse and inclusive workplace. All Avalanchers have a shared responsibility to create an open work environment where everyone is treated equally and respectfully. Being part of our world is not contingent on your heritage, your gender, or sexual orientation. It’s all about your passion and creativity.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 To apply for this position, please register below and provide your CV in English. We review applications continuously. All further studio-related information is provided under a non-disclosure agreement.
   

  

*At Avalanche Studios Group we're always on the lookout for talented individuals to join our passionate team, but please not that relocation assistance is not available for this role.*
 Apply now

title: Group Accountant
description:
Would you like to further develop your career within one of Sweden’s largest multinational companies and contribute your expertise to a competent and dedicated Group Reporting team? As Group Accountant at Securitas, you will have the opportunity to play a key role in delivering high-quality financial and operational reporting while contributing to the company’s continued success.
 



  





**What Securitas Offers You** 




 As Group Accountant, you will be part of the Group Reporting team, which has extensive and solid experience in group accounting. The team is responsible for the quarterly and annual external financial reporting, both for the business segments and for the group, as well as the operational reporting, which covers five divisions operating in 44 markets. Securitas’ finance function is currently undergoing a significant transformation journey, which means you will be involved in various change and efficiency projects, as well as contributing to the implementation of a new consolidation system.
 



  





**Your Responsibilities** 




 You will be a key player in the work related to consolidation in compliance with IFRS, including in-depth analysis of reporting, managing and consolidating acquisitions, disposals, cash flow, equity, and ensuring the accuracy and quality of quarterly reports and annual financial statements. You will also be responsible for producing and developing reports and reporting packages, as well as participating in budget and forecasting processes. The role is varied, and the team rotates responsibilities to ensure that everyone can serve as a backup for each other, while also enabling you to expand your expertise across several strategic areas. In your role, you will work with a variety of contacts, including finance functions in different countries and divisions, as well as a significant part of Group Finance at Securitas.
 



  





**Who Are You?** 




 To succeed in the role of Group Accountant, you need to be efficient, resilient and possess a strong ability to prioritize. Delivering high-quality work comes naturally to you, and you always ensure that your work is well-structured. Given the dynamic environment within Securitas’ finance department, it’s important that you have a positive attitude towards change and innovation and that you thrive in a fast-paced setting. You enjoy tackling complex challenges and finding solutions, with a genuine interest in regulations and accounting issues.
 



  





 In terms of your experience, you have an education in finance, along with solid experience in group accounting. Experience in an international and publicly listed environment, as well as strong knowledge of IFRS, will be crucial for success in this role. Lastly you have previous experience with consolidation systems and we expect you to be fluent in English, both spoken and written.
 



  





**Application** 




 In this recruitment, Securitas AB is collaborating with Prodiem. Selection and interviews will be conducted on an ongoing basis, so we encourage you to submit your application as soon as possible. Applications should be submitted via Prodiem’s website
 
 www.prodiem.se
 
 . If you have any questions, please contact Agnes Hallén at Prodiem, phone 073-388 22 62.
 



  





 We look forward to receiving your application!
 



  





*Securitas is a world-leading safety and security solutions partner that helps make your world a safer place. By leveraging technology in partnership with our clients, we offer a broad portfolio of value-enhancing services and solutions integrated across the security value chain – from on-site services to advanced monitoring, comprehensive risk prediction and advisory services.* 




  





*With around 336 000 employees in 44 markets, our innovative, holistic approach with local and global expertise makes us a trusted business partner to many of the world’s best-known companies. Benefitting from nine decades of deep experience and guided by our values of integrity, vigilance, and helpfulness, we create sustainable value by helping our clients optimize their operations and protect what matters most – their people and assets.*

title: Senior Manager, Scientific Content and Behavioural Engagement Writer - Anywhere in Europe
description:
Generics [U.K.] Ltd.
   

  

 At VIATRIS, we see healthcare not as it is but as it should be. We act courageously and are uniquely positioned to be a source of stability in a world of evolving healthcare needs.
   

  

 Viatris empowers people worldwide to live healthier at every stage of life.
   

  

 We do so via:
   

  

 Access – Providing high quality trusted medicines regardless of geography or circumstance;
   

  

 Leadership – Advancing sustainable operations and innovative solutions to improve patient health; and
   

  

 Partnership – Leveraging our collective expertise to connect people to products and services.
   

  

 Our global portfolio includes best-in-class, iconic brand-name products as well as global key brands; generics, including branded and complex generics; and other offerings across a wide range of therapeutic areas. We are committed to helping create healthier communities worldwide through education, outreach and better access to treatment.
   

  

 For those driven to live their lives with purpose, Viatris helps employees realise their full potential by creating a collaborative culture that fosters courage and resilience. Viatris is more than just a place to work. This is a place to make a difference in the world.
   

  

**The Role & What You Will Be Doing**
 We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced
 **Scientific Content Writer** 
 to join our team at Viatris. This role requires a dynamic individual with a strong understanding of
 **hospital-based care** 
 , a passion for scientific communication, and a keen interest in leveraging technology and behavioural science to drive impactful content development. The successful candidate will work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to create high-quality scientific materials that support our products and therapeutic areas.
   

  

 Every day, we rise to the challenge to make a difference and the
 **Senior Manager, Scientific Content and Behavioural Engagement Writer** 
 role will make an impact through the following responsibilities:
   

  

* Develop scientifically accurate content, including value propositions, key messages, clinical reports, and materials, to effectively communicate therapy benefits and drive behavior change in healthcare professionals and patients.
* Utilize your in-depth knowledge of hospital environments to craft tailored communication strategies for healthcare professionals, including clinicians, nurses, and decision-makers.
* Incorporate principles of behavioural science into content creation to enhance audience engagement, comprehension, and retention.
* Collaborate with teams to explore and implement innovative technologies (e.g., AI tools, data visualization platforms) to improve the efficiency and impact of scientific writing processes.
* Work closely with clinical, regulatory, marketing, and medical affairs teams to align on messaging and ensure accuracy and compliance with industry standards.
* Conduct comprehensive literature reviews and stay updated on the latest research, trends, and developments in relevant therapeutic areas.
* Manage multiple writing projects simultaneously, ensuring timely delivery while maintaining the highest quality standards.
* Adhere to regulatory and ethical guidelines, including GPP (Good Publication Practices), ICMJE, and company-specific policies.


**About Your Skills & Experience**
 For this role, we’re looking for a candidate who has an effective combination of the following qualifications, skills, and experiences:
   

  

* Advanced degree in life sciences (PhD, PharmD, or MSc preferred).
* Proven experience in scientific writing, particularly within hospital settings.
* Familiarity with behavioural science concepts and their application to scientific communication.
* Comfort with using and adopting new technologies to enhance work processes (e.g., medical writing software, AI tools, or data visualization platforms).
* Strong understanding of clinical research, regulatory requirements, and medical terminology.
* Excellent writing, editing, and communication skills with attention to detail.
* Ability to translate complex scientific concepts into accessible, engaging, and audience-appropriate materials.


**Benefits At Viatris**
 At Viatris, we offer competitive salaries, benefits and an inclusive environment where you can use your experiences, perspectives and skills to help make an impact on the lives of others. Some of our benefits include the following on top of a competitive salary:
   

  

* Top Employer Accreditation, demonstrating that we provide excellent people policies and practices
* Competitive compensation package
* Focus on career progression with growth and development opportunities
* Emphasis on Health & Wellness programmes
* 100% paid medical insurance and Employee Assistance Programme
* Life cover
* Excellent employer-matched pension scheme with Viatris contributing up to 11%
* 2 paid volunteer days per year


 At Viatris, we are dedicated to building a truly diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t fully align with every requirement, we still encourage you to apply. You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles.
   

  

**Diversity & Inclusion at Viatris**
 At Viatris, diversity and inclusion are essential to our mission. The diversity we foster in all aspects of our business can be one of our greatest strengths in redefining healthcare not as it is, but as it should be. If you would like to know more about what diversity, equity and inclusion means to us, please visit https://www.viatris.com/en/Careers/Diversity-and-Inclusion
   

  

**Sustainability at Viatris**
 Corporate social responsibility is fundamental to the Viatris mission. We work to advance responsible and sustainable operations and leverage our collective expertise to empower people to live healthier at every stage of life, recognizing that our actions affect the stakeholders and communities we serve. To learn more about our efforts, please visit https://www.viatris.com/en/about-us/corporate-responsibility
   

  

 At Viatris, we offer competitive salaries, benefits and an inclusive environment where you can use your experiences, perspectives and skills to help make an impact on the lives of others.
   

  

 Viatris is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: AI modeler / Dataanalyst
description:
Job description
 
 #Wearegrowing!
 



  





 Company Description
 



 Geofy envisions a future where every homeowner controls their energy needs and is essentially self-sufficient in energy and electricity. Currently, few households have the opportunity to become self-sufficient in energy and electricity. Geofy's energy subscription provides all households a simple solution to this complex problem.
 



  





 Role Description:
 



 This is a full-time on-site role for an AI Modeler / Data Analyst at Geofy in Stockholm.
 



 The role involves day-to-day tasks in
 


* many AI models and data analysis.
* Writing novel state-of-the-art models in Python, torch, TensorFlow, etc.
* Writing code to enable the backend API to make inferences.
* Writing code to get access to other available system data.
* Integrating with the development, operations, and Sales teams to provide business-critical features



  





 Example of projects:
 



 a) We have multiparameter models that encompass thermodynamics, temperature variation over time, energy assessment and consumption, geographic location, and other factors. We are using it to model a scenario and select the best solution based on that scenario.
 



  





 We have used this model, which works well, and we now have a lot of extra data. We want to use this data to enhance or expand the model to a new second-tier model for feedback into the sales cycle.
 



  





 b) We will integrate many services, APIs, and hardware and gather data. We can also change how the data is produced and thus implement feedback loops in near real-time through reinforced learning models, interpret the results, and provide feedback to a control system.
 



  





 If you don't fit the bill perfectly, don't worry. We are learning as well!
 



  





 Qualifications:
 


* AI modeler with a few years experience - knowledge of LSTM, LGBM,
* Data analyst working datasets in Python, TensorFlow,
* Senior full-stack JS with a focus on the data, backend, and integration
* Can-do mentality
* Experience with energy or sustainability projects is a plus
* Preferred Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or similar work experience.



  






 Plus: Knowledge of match.ai, pydantic.ai, relevance.ai etc..
 




  





 NOTE: We like to work together, so being in the Stockholm office daily is key.

title: Senior DevOps Ingenjör inom Cloud
description:
Är du en erfaren DevOps ingenjör som drivs av teknik, användarvänlighet och kvalité? Har du passion för skalbara system, automation och cloud infrastruktur? Då kan du vara rätt för oss!
   

  

 Vi söker en DevOps ingenjör som vill hjälpa våra kunder inom DevOps området och samtidigt komplettera Mekatronikchefen genom att driva utveckling inom ditt expertområde.
   

  

 Du har ett genuint intresse för teknikutveckling och vi tror att du på fritiden håller dig uppdaterad inom branschen. Din passion för teknik, människan och affären driver dig att ständigt utforska nya lösningar och möjligheter.
   

  

 Som Senior DevOps ingenjör på Sigma Industry Development kommer du att hjälpa våra kunder med att driva strategier och samtidigt vara hands-on inom:
   

  

  

* programmering med Python
* molntjänster som AWS, Azure eller Google Cloud.
* automatisera infrastrukturdistribution, ex. Terraform, Ansible eller CloudFormation
* Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD)
* kvalitativ versionskontroll för källkodshantering ex. GitHub eller GitLab
* nightly test & daily test ex. Jenkins, GitLab CI eller Travis CI
* orkestrering och container teknologier såsom Docker, Kubernetes
* övervakningslösningar (t.ex. Prometheus, Grafana) och centraliserad loggning (t.ex. ELK stack)


 GRUNDLÄGGANDE KVALIFIKATIONER
   

  

 Vi söker dig som vill vara nära tekniken och är van och trygg i att tekniskt leda andra.
   

  

  

* Ca 10 års professionell erfarenhet inom DevOps fältet.
* Lång professionell erfarenhet inom programmering med Python för automation och scriptning. Meriterande med kunskap inom fler programmeringsspråk.
* Lång professionell erfarenhet inom molntjänster såsom AWS, Azure eller Google Cloud.
* Förståelse för bästa praxis inom IT-säkerhet för infrastruktur och applikationer,
* Kännedom om nätverkskoncept och konfigurering av nätverksinfrastruktur.
* Agila metoder – Kännedom om agila ramverk som Scrum eller Kanban för effektiv projektledning.
* Flytande i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.


**Utbildning:**
* Civilingenjörsexamen inom datavetenskap, elektroteknik eller motsvarande område.


 VI ERBJUDER
   

  

 Vi är stora nog för att kunna erbjuda en bred kundbas och vi har ett gott rykte i branschen, samtidigt som vi är små nog att se dig som individ. För oss är gemenskap viktigt – här ska alla känna sig sedda och välkomna. Som en följd av detta har vi bland annat gemensamma sektionsaktiviteter, ett nätverk för kvinnor och icke-binära, ett mentorskapsprogam och utbildningar inom olika kompetensområden.
   

  

 Vi strävar efter att skapa en miljö där alla kan växa och utvecklas tillsammans. Vår ambition är att tillgodose konsultens önskemål gällande uppdragslängd, sektor och arbetsuppgifter. För oss är en bra balans mellan arbete och privatliv en självklarhet och vi är stolta över att vara en av Sveriges mest attraktiva arbetsgivare. Givetvis har vi också kollektivavtal (via Almega).
   

  

**Om Sigma Industry Development**
 Sigma Industry Development är ett teknik- och konsultbolag inom Sigmagruppen som hjälper både ledande svenska och internationella teknikföretag och innovativa och nytänkande start-ups och scale-ups. Vi verkar inom sektorer så som den gröna energisektorn, fordonsindustrin, transportindustrin, medtech, försvarsbranchen och hållbarhet.
   

  

 Vår vision är att vara det ledande teknikkonsultbolaget och vår kultur präglas av familjär samhörighet där människan är i centrum. Med över 100 engagerade medarbetare är vi i en stark tillväxtfas. Vår kärnverksamhet ligger i konsultuppdrag ute hos kund, men vi har även ett in-house-team som arbetar uteslutande från kontoret. Precis som vårt namn antyder, är utveckling kärnan i allt vi gör och våra medarbetare engageras av att ta Sigma Industry Development till nästa nivå.
   

  

**OM SIGMA GROUP**
 Sigma Industry Development AB (SID) är ett av sex dotterbolag som ingår i koncernen Sigma Industry East/North Group, vilka i sin tur ingår i Sigma Group (som ägs av familjekoncernen Danir AB). Läs mer om Sigma Industry Development HÄR och om Sigma Group på HÄR.
   

  

 Utöver att vara del av ett företag som värnar om teknologisk utveckling, arbetar för en bättre miljö och som främjar jämställdhet, så är en viktig del av vår verksamhet socialt ansvarstagande. Mer information om detta hittar du HÄR.
   

  

 Sista ansökningsdag
   

  

 2025-03-31
   

  

 MER INFORMATION
   

  

 För mer information kontakta:
   

  

 Kristoffer Billqvist
   

  

 Sektionschef
   

  

 Sigma Industry Development, Stockholm
   

  

 Mekatronik
   

  

 070-810 20 82
   

  

 kristoffer.billqvist@sigma.se
   

  

 LinkedIn
   

  

 070-810 20 82
   

  

 kristoffer.billqvist@sigma.se
   

  

 LinkedIn

title: Jakt- och klövviltsansvarig till Svealand
description:
**Välkommen till en grön värld av möjligheter hos oss på Sveaskog. Vi erbjuder dig skogen – en vacker arbetsplats och framför allt ett av våra viktigaste bidrag för att klara utmaningar kopplade till klimatförändringar och framtidens råvaruförsörjning. Nu söker vi en jakt- och klövviltsansvarig till region Svealand som vill vara med oss på resan.**
**Vi erbjuder**
 Att arbeta på Sveaskog innebär stor frihet samtidigt som du förväntas ta ansvar, visa mod och vara nyfiken, Sveaskogs värdeord. I allas uppdrag ingår att ta ansvar för sin egen och verksamhetens utveckling och att vara en bra kollega. Vi kallar det aktivt medarbetarskap. Vi erbjuder dig attraktiva förmåner och en arbetsplats som kännetecknas av en vilja att du ska lyckas, där jämställdhet och hållbart arbetsliv står högt på agendan. Sveaskog eftersträvar mångfald och en jämn könsfördelning inom alla yrken i företaget.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Jakt och fiske är en viktig resurs som ska förvaltas på ett klokt och hållbart sätt. Jakten är ett viktigt verktyg för att anpassa viltstammen till fodersituation, skadenivå och biologisk mångfald. Klövviltets antal ska anpassas så att Sveriges långsiktiga mål för skogsskötsel och naturvård uppnås. Vi eftersträvar friska klövviltsstammar av god kvalitet i växtliga skogar utan alltför stora viltbetesskador.
   

  

 På Sveaskog arbetar tio jakt- och klövviltsansvariga fördelat på fem olika regioner. Till region Svealand söker vi nu en jakt- och klövviltsansvarig som ska företräda Sveaskog i jakt- och klövviltsfrågor på regionen. På regionen arbetar idag två Jakt- och klövviltsansvariga och en Fiskeansvarig.
   

  

 I rollen som jakt- och klövviltsansvarig leder du arbetet med klövviltsförvaltningen och ansvarar för att utveckla jaktaffären på regionen tillsammans med regionens medarbetare. Arbetet innebär externa kontakter där du samverkar med kunder, jägare, andra markägande bolag, myndigheter och företrädare för intresseorganisationer. I rollen kommer du att ingå i Sveaskogs interna nätverk för jakt- och klövviltsansvariga. Arbetet kräver en del kvälls- samt helgjobb vilket gör att du måste vara beredd att arbeta på obekväma tider. Tjänsten innehåller en del resor i samband med fysiska möten.
   

  

**I Rollen Kommer Du Också Att Arbeta Med**
* Administration av avtal, personliga jaktkort, fakturahantering, avskjutningsrapport och tilldelning
* Ansvara för budget och verksamhetsplan för ditt arbetsområde
* Analysera foderprognos, inventeringsresultat samt upprätta förvaltningsplaner
* Företräda Sveaskog i älgförvaltnings- och älgskötselområden
* Aktivt arbeta tillsammans med jaktlag till exempel genom jaktledarutbildning och rekrytering av nya jägare


 Stationering i Skinnskatteberg alternativt Örebro. Du kommer att rapportera till Skogsanvarig på regionen.
   

  

**Om dig**
 Du har en relevant skoglig akademisk utbildning eller motsvarande kompetens. Du har erfarenhet av skogligt arbete och då gärna med fokus på jakt- och fiskefrågor. Du har goda IT-kunskaper samt grundläggande GIS-kunskaper.
   

  

 Som person är du är resultatorienterad och har en god analysförmåga och ett strukturerat arbetssätt. Du är initiativtagande och har förmåga att arbeta självständigt. Du har hög integritet och en god kommunikativ förmåga, såväl i tal som i skrift.
   

  

**Vill du bli vår kollega?**
 Välkommen att söka jobbet senast den 2025-03-14.
   

  

 Har du frågor om tjänsten, kontakta Skogsansvarig Börje Eriksson, tel 010-544 95 56.
   

  

 Fackliga kontaktpersoner är för Akademikerföreningen Emil Linell, tel 072-201 80 01 för Ledarna Thomas Esbjörnsson, tel 070-550-82-35 och för Unionen Ove Ejemalm, tel 070-275 88 67.
   

  

**Om Sveaskog**
 Sveaskog är Sveriges största skogsägare och ägs av svenska staten. Bolaget äger 14 procent av Sveriges skogsmarker och har cirka 800 medarbetare runt om i landet. Våra kontor finns från Tärendö i norr till Osby i söder.

title: Pixi.js Developer
company_industry: Gambling Facilities and Casinos and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
ITRS (iGaming) have partnered up with an up-and-coming Games Studio headquartered in Stockholm.
 



  





 This role will involve online casino / slot game development using Pixi.js.
 



  





**Please note you must have used Pixi.js or similar tool (i.e. Phaser.js) to be considered.** 




  





**Please note: Applicants who aren't located in Stockholm cannot not be considered.** 




  





  





 You'll be working on developing slot game features, and helping to support the Senior Developers as they continue to build the custom tools that will be the building blocks of their game development for years to come.
 



  





 For this role, you should have:
 



  




* JavaScript/Typescript or C# (essential)
* Pixi.js (essential)
* Slot game experience (a bonus)
* Keen to work at an early stage start-up



  





 In return, you'll receive comprehensive training from some of the most experienced and respected names in the iGaming industry.
 



  





 We are open to speaking with candidates with as little as 1 year's experience, up to 5 years' experience, so the base salary will vary significantly. As a rough estimate, SEK 35k to SEK 50k pm is the ballpark depending on experience.
 



  





 This role is based in a nice office in South Stockholm, working mainly onsite with some flex if needed.
 



  





 If you're skilled in Pixi.js and open to working in an exciting, startup environment, then apply now!

title: PostNord Graduate Program 2025
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
**PostNords Graduateprogram** 
 erbjuder flera spännande möjligheter för dig som är - eller snart är - nyutexaminerad med akademisk bakgrund och vill rivstarta din karriär. 4 personer erbjuds ett tio månader långt program med omfattande och omväxlande lärande från flera olika delar av vår organisation. Vi har behov inom ett antal olika områden som du kan ansöka till, samtliga med placering på vårt unika huvudkontor Arken i Stockholm.
   

  

 Branschen vi verkar i utvecklas snabbare än någonsin och vi jobbar ständigt med att förbättra våra produkter och tjänster. Marknadens dynamik, konsumentförväntningar samt miljö- och hållbarhetskrav ställer oss inför mängder av utmaningar – och möjligheter. Vi ligger redan i framkant när det gäller innovation men målet är att bli ännu snabbare, smartare och smidigare. För att lyckas behöver vi fler medarbetare som vågar testa nytt för att förstå nya generationers köpbeteenden och mottagarupplevelser. Som Graduate hos PostNord får du vara med på en resa som handlar om att fortsätta ligga i täten teknologiskt, hållbarhetsmässigt och konkurrensmässigt.
   

  

 Vi söker personer som vill utvecklas inom följande affärsområden:
   

  

* Transformation Office: I denna roll kommer du som Graduate att stötta och driva analysarbete kring både marknadsutveckling, konkurrensanalys, konsumentpreferenser, strategi och kostnadsoptimering. En stor del av arbetet kommer innebära att ta fram och analysera data och därtill även projektledning. Förslagsvis har du studerat: På Handelshögskola, Civilekonom, Civilingenjör med inriktning Industriell Ekonomi eller liknande.
* Process- och verksamhetsutveckling inom Logistik: Inom PostNords affärsområde Logistik sker en kraftig utveckling. Här kommer du som Graduate att ha fokus på att bidra kring projektledning, genomföra data-analyser och ta fram datadrivna beslutsunderlag för att driva vår verksamhet framåt på ett mer effektivt och träffsäkert sätt. PostNord har en av Sveriges största fordonsflottor i sin verksamhet och har många komplexa logistiska kedjor för att kunna leverera tjänster till kunder över hela landet. Förslagsvis har du du studerat: Civilingenjör med inriktning industriell ekonomi, logistik, Technology Management eller Supply Chain.
* Sales Intelligence Parcel: Inom Postnords affärsområde Paket sker en offensiv utveckling. E-handeln ställer ständigt nya krav på både återförsäljare och leverantörer för att möta kundernas behov. Som Graduate kommer du att hantera projekt kopplat till våra system mot CRM (SalesForce) och Business Intelligence (Power-BI). Målet är att skapa bättre insikt och få effekt inom vår försäljning genom att förstå vår data på minsta detalj. Detta kan sedan ligga till grund för hur vi möter våra kunder och marknad på bästa sätt. Förslagsvis har du studerat ingenjörsutbildning inom IT, digitalisering, automatisering eller verksamhetsutveckling.
* Process- och verksamhetsutveckling inom Brev: Inom PostNords affärsområde Brev är mitt i en transformationsresa - där vi hela tiden vänder och vrider på hur vi kan uppnå hög kvalitet i våra tjänster men också anpassa oss efter hur marknaden ser ut. Vi har en otrolig förmåga att ta brevet hela vägen fram, det är något vi förfinat i snart 400 år, men vi behöver ständigt utmana oss själva i hur vi arbetar. Här kommer du som Graduate att ha fokus på att bidra kring projektledning, göra analyser och ta fram beslutsunderlag för att driva vår verksamhet framåt på ett mer effektivt och träffsäkert sätt. Förslagsvis har du du studerat: Civilingenjör med inriktning industriell ekonomi, logistik, Technology Management eller Supply Chain.


 ,
   

  

**Vi Söker Dig Med**
* Examen från Högskola/Universitet inom ämnen såsom Civilingenjör, Civilekonom, Logistik, Systemvetenskap, IT, Industriell ekonomi, Maskinteknik, Technology Management eller motsvarande.
* Du talar och skriver svenska och engelska obehindrat.
* Du har förståelse för fördelarna med digitalisering, automatisering, digitala verktyg och AI.
* Du är unik: Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.


 Är du en person som vill utveckla din affärsmässiga och analytiska förmåga, som är nyfiken, driven och lösningsorienterad samtidigt som du gärna bygger relationer och nätverk? Då är det dig vi söker!
   

  

 Hur ser rekryteringsprocessen ut?
   

  

* Annonsering och urval Vi kontaktar ett urval av kandidater som får genomföra arbetspsykologiska tester kopplade till de kompetenser vi eftersöker hos våra Graduates.
* Första dialog och Graduate-dag De kandidater som bäst matchar våra önskade kompetenser blir inbjudna till en digital intervju. Ett antal kandidater kommer sedan att bjudas in till vår Graduate-dag i Stockholm den 10 april. Dagen består bland annat av interaktion med nyckelpersoner inom organisationen samt individuella möten med chefer. Man får även möjligheten att träffa tidigare Graduates.
* Erbjudande från PostNord Efter Graduatedagen kommer vi att kontakta de kandidater som bäst matchar de specifika behov vi söker för att erbjuda anställning.


 Så vad väntar du på?
   

  

 Graduateprogrammet startar i september 2025. Skicka in din ansökan nu och låt oss ta reda på om du är vår nästa talang genom att svara på ett antal videofrågor samt bifoga CV och betyg från din utbildning. Vi rekryterar löpande så sök redan idag för att säkra din plats. Rekryteringsprocessen sker utifrån ett mångfald och jämställdhetsperspektiv, där vi bland annat använder oss av arbetspsykologiska tester som en del i urvalet.
   

  

 Har du några frågor är du välkommen att höra av dig till oss på graduateprogram@postnord.com

title: Business Intelligence Developer
description:
**HAYPP GROUP**
 We address one of the world’s biggest problems – how to end smoking. There are 1,1 billion smokers in the world. Around 8 million people die every year from smoking-related diseases. Our goal is to significantly reduce death rates, save lives and inspire people to choose healthier enjoyment. How? By offering people safer nicotine online.
   

  

 Haypp Group is one of the Nordics’ leading e-commerce groups with ten store brands, present in seven countries where we serve more than 1 million active consumers. Through brands such as Snusbolaget.se, Northerner.com, Nicokick.com etc., we sell nicotine pouches as well as Swedish style snus online. With our headquarters located on Östgötagatan in Stockholm we are 250 team members mainly but not exclusively based in Sweden. Also, we are an innovative and fast-moving company that is growing rapidly, driving sustainable business and are changing the world in the process. We are currently on an exciting expansion journey, converting more and more smokers to healthier alternatives across all our markets globally.
   

  

**THE ROLE**
 At Haypp Group, data is our DNA. Within Haypp Lab, our insights department, we’re a diverse, talented group of 13 people who are driven by a shared mission and a positive, can-do attitude. We’re not just about numbers—we’re about creating real insights that drive business and bring value to our customers. Our team works closely with manufacturers, researchers, universities, and even governmental institutions to help move the industry forward and give consumers smarter, healthier choices.
   

  

 We don’t settle for "just okay." We're pushing the limits of what our data platform can do, and we need a rockstar BI Developer to join our team, step up our game, and partner with us to deliver top-tier business insights. If you’re someone who thrives on making a big impact and working collaboratively, we want you to join us in this exciting journey. Bonus points if you’re an expert in Qlik Sense!
   

  

**Here’s how you'll go the extra mile in your role:**
* Understanding and Translating Client Needs: You’ll work hand-in-hand with external clients to understand their needs and transform them into sharp, actionable visualizations that make a difference. You’re not just delivering data—you’re delivering insight that matters.
* Building Data Models: You’ll craft Qlik Sense user experiences that are intuitive, simple, and impactful, always keeping the business goals at the forefront.
* Ad-hoc Analysis for Clients: You’ll jump in when the business needs it, running quick but meaningful analyses that directly support urgent client requests.
* Data Quality & Validation: You'll make sure that every report we create is not just accurate but trustworthy and actionable for our clients.
* Data Governance: Working closely with our Data Engineers and Data Scientists, you'll ensure that our data is aligned with company best practices, secure, and structured in a way that makes extracting insights easy.
* Tool Administration: You’ll manage access for both internal and external users, ensuring that the right people have the right tools to get things done.
* User Training and Support for Clients: You'll lead training sessions, teaching our clients how to make the most of our dashboards and ensuring they feel confident using our insights to drive decisions.


**What We Want From You**
 For us, it's not just about technical skills—it’s about finding the right teammate who shares our values and can collaborate with others in a positive, open, and supportive environment. We want someone who can roll up their sleeves, take on challenges, and do whatever it takes to help the team succeed.
   

  

**Basic qualifications to succeed in the role:**
* Solid experience with BI tools any of: Qlik Sense, Tableau, Power BI (Qlik Sense experience is a big plus).
* Experience with report automation (NPrinting experience is a bonus).
* An understanding of SQL for querying and fetching data.
* A knack for working closely with the business to translate data into powerful visualizations.
* A structured approach to work—ensuring KPIs and metrics are clearly defined and documented.
* Strong communication and presentation skills—able to break down complex data into clear, business-friendly insights.
* Fluency in English, both written and spoken.
* Minimum 3 years experience


**What We Offer**
 We are a value driven company with our values
 *We team up* 
 ,
 *Innovation Drives Us* 
 ,
 *No Douchebags* 
 and
 *Going the Extra Mile* 
 at the heartbeat of everything that we do. With us you can always expect to get help from people who want to achieve things together and to be able to speak your mind in every social constellation you are part of. We highly value all ideas no matter where they come from, and we are not afraid to try new things out. We are also welcoming, inclusive and everyone at Haypp Group has a voice. In addition, we seize opportunities by putting in hands-on, hard work and celebrating when we reach our goals. With us, you should always feel safe, appreciated and valued but at the same time challenged and excited.
   

  

 Because we recognize that our team members are our most important differentiator, we offer our team members generous benefits. We offer the following perks to everyone at Haypp Group:
   

  

* Premium ITP1 occupational pension savings plan
* Insurance plan, including private healthcare
* 30 days of paid vacation
* Parental pay lift
* Wellness allowance of 5,000 SEK per year
* Lots of social happenings


**SEND US YOUR APPLICATION TODAY!**
 If this sounds like a place where you would want to contribute and grow, let us know you’re interested by submitting your application! Apply with your CV, a cover letter, through Linkedin or in any other way you feel represents you in the clearest possible way. All ways of connecting work for us!
   

  

 Haypp Group is committed to equality and diversity, and we welcome applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, religion, age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, and marital status. We want to offer you great recruitment experience, and if there is anything we can do to make you more comfortable in the process with us, please let us know.
   

  

 If you have any questions about the role or what it’s like to work at Haypp Group in general, feel free to reach out to our responsible recruiter Max Moen at max.moen@hayppgroup.com. We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 The Haypp Group is spearheading the global transformation from smoking to healthier product alternatives. With origins in Scandinavia our extensive experience from pioneering markets in smoke free alternatives, as well as being a leader in the e-commerce sector, we now fully bring our vision to a global scale.
   

  

 With ten e-commerce brands, the Haypp Group is present in seven countries where we serve more than 950 000 consumers.

title: Development Engineer Valvetrain
description:
**Role Summary**
 Do you want to be at the forefront of engine development? The Valvetrain team at Scania Engine Development are looking for a Development Engineer to join our expanding team, focusing on developing our engine platforms to meet future emissions legislation globally. The role entails developing new hardware and integrating it with other engine systems and functions.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
 We are currently facing an exciting time in our new engine projects where many new systems and functions are being developed. We are looking for a driven development engineer who can take a central role in this development process to lead, plan, communicate and secure the system's cross-functional deliveries against set goals.
   

  

 The tasks will mainly consist of driving the development of valvetrain components towards our suppliers and being part of the work to meet different internal customers' wishes and requirements for the entire system. The work is cross-functional with many groups and departments involved, including production and purchasing, which means that you will build a large network of contacts.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We are looking for a candidate with a suitable academic master's degree, for example in mechanical engineering or similar. Ideally you would have experience in powertrain development, although this is not required. We do however believe that you have previously worked with hardware development in some form.
   

  

 As a person, we see that you have a great drive, enjoy learning new things and have a good ability to absorb new information. You have experience of seeing how components interact and can draw conclusions from measurement and test data. Furthermore, we believe that you have a positive attitude and an outward-looking relationship-building approach and find it easy to work with other people. You work in a structured and results-oriented way, keeping a good overview without letting go of the details. We would be happy to see that you have a genuine interest in working with and developing internal combustion engines. You communicate fluently in English, both in writing and speaking, there is no requirement
   

  

 to know Swedish, but we would like you to have a willingness to learn the language and training can be provided.
   

  

**This Is Us**
 The valvetrain team you would be joining consists of 13 people, made of up 4 nationalities and with experience ranging from months to decades! We are a friendly and open team who work closely together to develop state-of-the-art valvetrains. We are a mixture of design and test engineers who collaborate closely on a daily basis to overcome various challenges together. We have a hybrid working environment, but regularly meet in the office to share ideas and most importantly fika!
   

  

**Scania Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes. Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-02-20. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role. If you have questions or would like more information, please contact: Group Manager, andrew.spencer@scania.com or +46855383485
   

  

 We look forward to your application!

title: Senior Electronic Engineer
description:
**Why Join Us?**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
   

  

 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our solutions.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 We’re at an exciting stage in our journey—growing rapidly and expanding our Product & Development team in Stockholm to build a vibrant hub for innovation, product design, and technology. This is a unique opportunity to join a thriving organization where you can help shape the future of assistive communication, defining how we work and delivering impactful solutions for our users.
   

  

 We are building a culture of empowered, collaborative teams who are passionate about helping individuals with disabilities find their voice and connect with the world. Our teams thrive on trust, collaboration, and a positive environment where everyone lead and contributes. We deeply understand the people we serve, empathize with their challenges, and use our expertise to make a real difference.
   

  

 As a Senior Electronic Engineer, you’ll be at the forefront of developing advanced AAC devices, helping individuals with communication-related disabilities connect with the world. You’ll apply your electronic design expertise to bring new products from concept to production while supporting and improving existing ones. This is a chance to combine technical excellence with purpose-driven work.
   

  

 In this role, you will:
   

  

* Write and review electronic requirements to ensure performance, cost, and schedule feasibility.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define design approaches and create error-free CAD models and 2D drawings.
* Select and integrate electronic components, ensuring manufacturability and functionality across prototypes, testing, and production.
* Develop and oversee electrical test plans, protocols, and reports to meet quality standards.
* Lead root cause analysis and corrective actions to enhance system performance.
* Support global production efforts by interfacing with external manufacturers and collaborating with teams across the U.S. and China.


**What We're Looking For:**
 We’re looking for a detail-oriented engineer with a passion for problem-solving and a collaborative mindset. You’re someone who thrives in cross-disciplinary teams, communicates effectively, and is motivated to tackle technical challenges while mentoring team members. You take ownership of your work and balance independent problem-solving with team-based collaboration.
   

  

 We’d like for you to have:
   

  

* Significant experience working with electrical engineering
* Proficiency in designing complex electronic systems and subassemblies using Altium or similar tools.
* Experience with microcontrollers, PCB development, and communication protocols (USB, I2C, SPI).
* Strong knowledge of testing tools like oscilloscopes and logic analyzers.
* Familiarity with highly regulated environments (e.g., FDA, ISO13485) and agency certifications (UL, CE).


**Our Values:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, our mission guides what we do, and our values guide us in how we do it. Across the organization, we are committed to being Collaborative, Considerate, Curious and Courageous. We build a trusting environment where every team member prioritizes our customers with empathy and insight. Bold ideas and learning lead to impactful solutions. Driven by curiosity, we continuously challenge the status quo to create meaningful, customer-focused solutions for our customers.
   

  

**What We Offer:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in empowering individuals – including our employees - to reach their full potential. Here’s what makes us unique:
   

  

* Purpose-Driven Work: Join a company that transforms lives by giving a voice to those with communication challenges. Every day, your work makes a meaningful and concrete impact.
* “Yes, and...” Flexibility: Build a rewarding career AND enjoy time with loved ones. We offer flexible work options so you don’t have to choose between personal and professional goals.
* Growth and Development: Whether you’re advancing your skills or growing your career, we invest in your future with training, learning opportunities, and internal growth paths.
* Inclusive and Supportive Culture: Work in a collaborative, caring environment where diversity and individuality are valued. You’ll feel connected to both your team and our global community.
* A Global Leader with Heart: Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking company that combines experience and cutting-edge solutions with a mission to change lives.

title: Software Developer - Gör skillnad på riktigt!
description:
*Vi driver utvecklingen av nästa generations hållbara informationssamhälle Ida Infront är ett väletablerat företag som verkar inom offentlig sektor i Norden. Med produkter baserade på iipax erbjuder vi nutidens och nästa generations digitala lösningar inom säkert informationsutbyte, effektiv ärendehantering och hållbar e-arkivering till samhället. Ida Infront grundades 1984 och har i dag ca 140 medarbetare i Linköping, Stockholm och Mumbai. Företaget är en del av Addnode Group vars aktie är noterad på Nasdaq Stockholm*
**Vill du vara med och forma framtiden på ett företag som verkligen värdesätter dina idéer? Hos oss på Ida Infront får du möjligheten att påverka, utvecklas och utmanas i en trygg och stabil miljö. Vi söker nu dig som har erfarenhet av att skapa framgångsrika lösningar och vill fortsätta din resa med oss, där dina idéer verkligen gör skillnad!**
 Som mjukvaruutvecklare inom området Case Solutions och portföljen Mississippi, arbetar du som fullstackutvecklare med Java som bas. Du jobbar med en stor kund med samhällskritisk funktion och får möjlighet att vara med och göra skillnad på riktigt!
   

  

 Du kommer att tillhöra ett agilt, självorganiserande team. Tillsammans med ditt team arbetar du för att förverkliga de krav som ställs på den kundlösning ni utvecklar. Ni är med på hela resan från ax till limpa och jobbar tätt tillsammans med verksamhetskonsulter och projektledare där ni gemensamt verkar för kundens behov.
   

  

**Ansvaret** 
 för den tekniska lösningen, har du och tillsammans med ditt team som innefattar arkitektur, design och val av teknik. Här får du därför möjligheten att påverka och forma de tekniska lösningarna i alla delar av utvecklingsprocessen.
   

  

**Feedback** 
 till dig och ditt team kommer bland annat genom möjligheten att ha direktkontakt med de kunder som använder den lösning ni arbetar med.
   

  

**Innovation- och förbättringsarbete** 
 får du gärna, som en del av ditt jobb, arbeta med genom vår egenutvecklade process ’Stay Infront’. Här får du både bidra med idéer samt möjlighet att erhålla budget avsatt för att testa och utveckla dem. Detta som en del av ditt jobb.
   

  

**Din placering** 
 kommer att vara på något av våra kontor i centrala Linköping eller i centrala Stockholm. Hos oss prioriteras balans mellan jobb och fritid högt, och vi erbjuder därför flexibla arbetstider och möjlighet till distansarbete till exempel från ditt hemmakontor. Vi fokuserar på att skapa en hälsosam arbetsmiljö för att främja just ditt välmående.
   

  

**Du får en god** 
**introduktion** 
 av ditt team och via Ida University som är ett skräddarsytt introduktionsprogram för att komma in i arbetet och fortsätta utvecklas med oss.
   

  

 Din profil
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har några års erfarenhet av programmering. Du brinner för att arbeta med mjukvaruutveckling och har erfarenhet av utveckling i Java 11 eller senare samt JEE. Vi tror att du har Du har en högskole- eller universitetsexamen med systemutveckling som inriktning eller motsvarande yrkeserfarenhet.
   

  

 Du har svenskt medborgarskap, vilket krävs för att arbeta i våra säkerhetsklassade projekt.
   

  

 Om Ida Infront
   

  

 Vi arbetar med digitalisering av samhället så vill du vara en viktig kugge i verksamheten och arbeta med att utveckla stora samhällsviktiga system så kan det här vara en möjlighet för dig! Vår produktfamilj iipax möjliggör bland annat ett passfritt Europa, e-deklarationer och effektiva dna-analyser.
